structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Purchasing agent for consolidated local government or county having city of first class.
law.text: Upon the establishment of a consolidated local government in a county which contained a city of the first class, the mayor may, every four (4) years, appoint a purchasing agent for a term of four (4) years. The fiscal court of each county containing a city of the first class shall, every four (4) years, beginning in 1928, appoint a purchasing agent for a term of four (4) years, the term of the first purchasing agent to begin May 1, 1928.
law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 346, sec. 63, effective July 15, 2002. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 907b-1, 907b-2.
